title: Are all idealist political ideologies roughly equivalent? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Are all idealist political ideologies roughly equivalent?” I suspect you are trying to ask something other than what these words say. I suggest you rewrite it. Perhaps you meant to ask something like “are all idealist political ideologies equally unrealistic?” The answer to that would be a firm “no.” Some are based around real human behavior and some are not, so no. As written, it’s logical to assume that you are implying that people who are living under a violent dictatorship, are having the same amount of fun, and experiencing the same amount of personal freedom as people who are living in a restrained democracy with established rights and so on. The answer to that is obviously “no” as well. So. What did you really have in mind?

Yes. Every ideology that has some dream of how the world should be, and is willing to use force to bring it about, is equally evil. It really doesn’t matter how attractive or abhorrent is the dream - it’s the idea that people are justified in using force to make it happen that makes it evil.

I think you could argue that most are equally bad or life-negating. The exception is possibly the ideal that breaks all the popular misconceptions that people refuse to entertain. That's how I feel about value systems. Society is fighting to overcome it's contradictions.
Yes. Security Programs. The “We” mentality. Freedom as Obedience to the ideology. The entitlement and overly contemptuous superiority that prevents them from living in shame.
